subject: Re: [junit] Correct Use of assertEquals()
msgSnippet: ... Advice for using assertEquals(): 1. You will need to implement the method: boolean equals(Object other); Otherwise, the default method from Object will be
messageBody:
--- Luis <lrb3000@...> wrote:
>I am using assertEquals() to compare the values of strings within two

Advice for using assertEquals():

1. You will need to implement the method:

boolean equals(Object other);

Otherwise, the default method from Object will be used

2. If you expect to use equals (or assertEquals) on the result of
toString() (as it appears you did here), the you need to implement
toString so that it will produce the same text for objects that are
semantically equal to each other.

My advice would be to go down the first path: directly compare the
objects (rather than results of a toString()) and do so by implementing
equals in your class.

Regards,

Rob
